I think this is an FAQ, but I could not completely understand the current status of the
incremental crawling with heritrix. I read the documents, the mailing list(this ML), and
tried heritrix with ARFrontier, deduplicator; to find,
1) ARFrontier repeatedly revisit the sites with respect to the Last-Modified header, however,
   cannot make checkpoints, so I cannot reboot the computer during the crawling,
2) deduplicator can store download information among crawls, so I can reboot the computer,
   however it does not store ETag or Last-Modified header, so it always download whole files
   and check SHA-1 checksums to check the identity.

Here, what I want to do is to crawl repeatedly a large site whose contents change little
by little continuously, like news sites. (Imagine that there are huge number of articles,
and articles are added continuously day by day.) 
I want to crawl such a site for years, once a week for example, while
1) sometimes stop (or suspend) the job for maintenance including reboot the computer, and
2) resume the job without recrawling the whole site by either
   2-a) checking only the HTTP headers like ETag or Last-Modified, or
   2-b) checking even only the URI name.
(If News sites has unique URI for each article, 2-b may be enough.)

To store different version of the same URI may be a problem, so it is enought to just keep the
latest version of the same URI.

Is this possible with current version of heritrix, or if not, is there any plan?
Thank you in advance.

---
	Takeshi Kobayakawa
